overview:
Paul Srivorakul is a serial internet entrepreneur and investor based in Thailand with experience in founding, funding, and managing internet companies across Southeast Asia.

He is currently the Co-Founder and Chairman of Ardent Capital (Ardentcap.com) a private capital fund, incubator, and accelerator in SE Asia.

Paul was the former Founder and CEO of Ensogo Group, the largest social commerce site in Thailand (Ensogo.com), Philippines (Ensogo.com.ph), and Indonesia (Dealkeren.com). Ensogo Group was acquired by LivingSocial in June 2011.

Prior to Ensogo, Paul was the Co-Founder and CEO of DMS Group, one of the leading digital marketing companies in S.E. Asia. DMS Group is a holdings company for Admax Network, the leading adnetwork in S.E. Asia and Impaq Interactive, an exclusive partner for MSN in Thailand (Acquired by Komli Media in Feb 2012).

DMS Group raised over $12 million in capital from investors, IDG Ventures Vietnam and SoftBank China & India Holdings.

Prior to DMS Group, Paul was the Co-Founder and CEO of New Media, a digital ad agency in Thailand and Vietnam which merged with Edge Marketing in 2010 and then acquired by STW Group in December 2011. STW Group is a publicly listed company in Australia with over 70 companies in its portfolio).

Prior to his entrepreneurial efforts, Paul worked as Head of Digital at Quest Media (Thailand) and Inside Sales at Ask Jeeves Inc. (Ask.com). Paul holds a BA in Archaeology from U.C. Berkeley

milestones.description: Ensogo & Dealkeren are the leading daily deal sites in Thailand, Indonesia, and Philippines.  (Acquired by Livingsocial in June 2011)

milestones.source_description: Chairman and Investor at Ardent Capital

milestones.description: The deal represents another successful piece of business for its founders, the Srivorakul brothers, who started Thailand-based group buying site Ensogo, which was sold to LivingSocial last year.
milestones.source_description: Digital ad firm Komli snaps up Admax to beef up its business in Southeast Asia
